page.title: 10NEWTON HALL
page.content: The impressive Hall and grounds were donated to the National Children's Home in 1900, opened as an orphanage in 1903 and by the 1920s there were 300 children in residence. Five houses and a chapel, an important centre of Methodist upbringing are situated around a circular lawn which has been used for many sporting and gala occasions. Boys were segragated to houses on one side of the circle, only meeting the girls on Sunday afternoons 'In the circle'. Many social events took place 'On the Branch' as the Hall was known, brownies and guides, hand bell ringing, a choir and inter house sports. In 1970, dividing the houses into flats created a family atmosphere Numbers admitted to the home gradually decreased, adoption becoming more popular. The home closes this year. 80 years of caring has come to an end.
